meanings.definition: Capable of happening or being done
meanings.sent1: The new plan seems possibler than the old one.
meanings.sent2: It is possibler to finish the project on time with extra help.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle ten balls at once is possibler than solving a Rubik's cube blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of flying without wings felt possibler than ever after skydiving.
meanings.sent5: The magician made the impossible seem possibler with his tricks.

meanings.definition: More likely to happen or be true than something else
meanings.sent1: Eating vegetables is possibler to improve your health than eating junk food.
meanings.sent2: It is possibler for it to rain in the summer than in the winter.
meanings.sent3: Winning the lottery is possibler than finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her smile made the gray day seem possibler to brighten up.
meanings.sent5: The detective found the missing clue, making the suspect's guilt even possibler.
